ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] W3C Note - User Agent Authentication FORM elements
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi ... Really? I thought _everyone_ had this problem! ... That would be great :-) Here is my test, using a site I have been working on, that anyone can signup

Hi

On Wed 26-Feb-2003 at 05:31:00PM +0000, Nic Ferrier wrote:
> Chris Croome <chris@...> writes:
> 
> > My confusion is how people set things up on the server side so
> > that after a client has, by mistake, typed the wrong passwd, and
> > submitted it they can be re-prompted for a username and passwd
> > again.
> 
> It's very curious this. I've _never_ had this problem, not even
> with commercial software. I'm using moz on linux as well, before
> that I used mainly navigator 4.x

Really? I thought _everyone_ had this problem!

> When I find time I'll construct and easily replicatable test for
> this and send it to you. It might be interesting to get to the
> bottom of the problem.

That would be great :-)

Here is my test, using a site I have been working on, that anyone
can signup for an account on (on the http interface):

  https://www.helpisathand.gov.uk/

  Username: foo 
  Password: bar

You then get an 401 and after you have this I have never been able
to get a new prompt for a uesername passords pair.

Chris
